提交信息: Add XOF tests at rate boundary
SHAKE: if the rate is exactly full, process that block before padding
SHAKE: align default separator and test vectors with Zig  And remove redundant macros
XOF: don't absorb/squeeze bytes one by one
XOF: use size_t internally, unsigned long long externally
buildbase.bat: prevent the PATH from getting too large
CI: try to use android NDK r29
configure.ac: fix typos in warning flags
Relax ((nonnull)) attributes where applicable  Reported by @stef -- Thanks!  Fixes #1477
Generate position-independent static libraries by default  ".pie" on a static library enables PIC when it is supported by the target.  Fixes #1474
apple-xcframework.sh: force cross-compilation when relevant  Works around instabilities of the latest Tahoe beta version
Wasmer now needs --mapdir=./:. to load files from the current directory

Reorder arguments to vaeseq_u8 to improve AArch64 performance  The register arguments to the AESE instruction are commutative, however the first input register is constrained in that it also names the output register. The constraint on register allocation causes recent LLVM versions to emit a lot of MOV instructions, significantly impacting performance.  Swapping the register operands allows the compiler to emit significantly fewer MOV instructions. This change improves performance on Arm infrastructure micro-architectures by 14-36% depending on the micro-architecture  Found and reported by George Steed from ARM. Thanks!
tests/sodium_utils3: skip SIGSEGV check when tsan is enabled  Fixes #1450
Add Android binaries to NuGet package (#1455)  Add android binaries to NuGet package
Try to go to the NDK directory containing "source.properties"
Check for ANDROID_NDK definition in android-aar.sh  Otherwise, the script can report success even though nothing compiles.

Android build scripts update for SDK level (#1443)  * Android build scripts: Changed default SDK level to 21; enabled specifying NDK_PLATFORM environment variable for custom SDK level; misc cleanup of Android build scripts  * Update android-aar.sh  I forgot to hit save on the script after making this change locally. The script works either way but by setting this value again in android-build.sh people can more easily build arch specific binaries if they want so the export is unnecessary but also rather meaningless.
Check that __cpuid() is not a macro
CI: upgrade Android SDK from 25c to 27c
Set the default Android platform to 21  Also explain that the "zip" command is required to build AAR archives and that NDK_PLATFORM can be used to override the target platform.  Fixes #1440
Build libsodium.dll with VC++ for win-arm64  Fixes #1431
dotnet-core CI: update Zig to version nightly 0.14.x  This fixes the compatibility issues with DLLs for Windows ARM64
xcframework: build full builds by default
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jedisct1/libsodium  * 'master' of github.com:jedisct1/libsodium:   Fix `buildbase.bat` for ARM64:   Use uint64_t sizes in aegis*_mac()

Fix `buildbase.bat` for ARM64:  - update version check to use **greater-than-or-equal**, i.e. to include VS 2019 **and** 2022 (or later versions) - select the `ARM64` environment (`x86_arm64` is not valid)
Use uint64_t sizes in aegis*_mac()  No-op in libsodium for now, but useful if we introduce a streaming API later.
Remove a non-constant modulo operation in argon2  Adapted from a change originally written by @Sc00bz
Decrement and shift in separate steps
Add assembly versions of equal() and negative()

randombytes_internal_random.c: move clang target attribute down  Specifically, move it after the system includes.  This appears to address an issue with clang 18 when cross-compiling to windows.  Fixes #1413

Merge branch 'master' of github.com:jedisct1/libsodium  * 'master' of github.com:jedisct1/libsodium:   Regen dist-build/emscripten.sh
Fix flaky non-deterministic box_seal tests  With very small messages, there's a significant probability that the ciphertext is identical to the message.  Fixes #1388
fe25519_{abs,cneg} require a single argument  They were always used with the same input and output pointers, so their definition can be simplified.  Fixes #1376

RFC9381 ECVRF implementation (#1188)  * Version 12 of ECVRF  * Incorrect ordering of function inputs  * Identation and notation  * single multiscalar multiplication function  Also changed the style of tests, where the expected output is in vrf.exp rather than in test data (following the style of the hashing).  * declarations inside the if code block  * identation of test_data  * Rename to RFC9381  * Move declarations to top of block  * Check small order over deserialised PK  * Include from_string functions in ed25519_ref10  * Update quirks.h  ---------  Co-authored-by: Frank Denis <124872+jedisct1@users.noreply.github.com>
AEGIS: improve performance of AD absorption on x86_64  No apparent regression on other platforms.  Adapted from libaegis.

Move includes in crypto_onetimeauth_poly1305.h outside of extern C (#1345)  Includes being outside of `extern "C"` are de-facto standard in all other include files of libsodium.  At the same time, having inside the `extern "C"` is causing problem with C++ vs. C toolchain being confused about which libraries should be linked. This was especially painful while working on `swift-sodium` integration with windows.
When using MSVC on aarch64, __ARM_ARCH is not defined  Reported by RADDI.net -- Thanks!

Zig: use "const" for variables that are never mutated
Revert "Include argon2id in crypto_pwhash_primitive()"  This reverts commit a2b12dfcc083a7c326200e5416d3930b3109ebee.
Add a comment where coordinates are expected to be normalized

Make aegis_mac() fallible  So that we can include additional checks, especially for weak states.  Ideally, weak states should be checked after every update, but they would be especially bad when the cipher is used as a stream cipher.  And in that case, checking for a weak state only at the end is sufficient.
Don't compile for VisionOS if Xcode doesn't support it  Drop APPLE_SILICON_SUPPORTED, since Xcode has had support for it for ages.
